workflow.name: Automate personalized assignment reminders for students with Canvas
workflow.description:
## Canvas: Send students their pending assignments

### How it works
1. Trigger the workflow and set the Canvas base URL and target course name.
2. Fetch all instructor courses and locate the course ID that matches the name.
3. Retrieve enrolled students and their unsubmitted submissions for the course, handling paginated results.
4. Merge student records with submission data, convert due dates to local time, and build a per-student summary.
5. Send a Canvas conversation to each student with a personalized list of pending assignments and links.

### Setup
- [ ] Connect Canvas API credentials (Bearer and header auth used by the workflow).
- [ ] Enter your Canvas base URL (e.g. https://your_educational_institution.instructure.com).
- [ ] Set the exact course name to check for pending work.
- [ ] Confirm the teacher account can view students and send conversations.
- [ ] Run the workflow manually to verify output and delivery.
- [ ] Edit the message subject or body template if you need different wording.

parameters.content: ## Get course ID by course name

pagination.nextURL: ={{ ( $response.headers.link || '' ) .split(',') .map(p => p.trim()) .find(p => p.includes('rel="next"')) ?.match(/<([^>]+)>/)?.[1] // captura a URL entre <...> || '' }}
={{ ( $response.headers.link || '' ) .split(',') .map(p => p.trim()) .find(p => p.includes('rel="next"')) ?.match(/<([^>]+)>/)?.[1] // captura a URL entre <...> || '' }}
pagination.completeExpression: ={{   /*     Checks if there is NO next link in pagination     (no Link header or no rel="next")   */   !$response.headers.link ||   !$response.headers.link.includes('rel="next"') }}

parameters.content: ## Get pending submissions by course ID and student ID

parameters.pythonCode:
# n8n - Code in Python (Native)
# Execution mode: Run Once for All Items
#
# Inputs:
#   - Multiple incoming items from the previous node (available as `_items`).
#   - Each incoming item is expected to contain:
#       item["json"]["body"]: a list of Canvas courses for a single pagination page.
#
# Purpose:
#   - Normalize Canvas pagination by flattening multiple "pages" of courses into
#     a single output stream.
#   - Emit one n8n-compliant item per course, wrapped under the required "json" key.
#
# Output:
#   - A list of items in the form:
#       [{"json": <course_dict>}, {"json": <course_dict>}, ...]


# Accumulates the flattened output (one item per course across all pages)
output_items = []

# In n8n Native Python, all incoming items are available via `_items`
for item in _items:
    # Safely extract the JSON payload from the current incoming item
    item_data = item.get("json", {}) or {}

    # Retrieve the list of courses for the current page (defaults to an empty list)
    body_courses = item_data.get("body") or []

    # Emit one output item per course
    for course in body_courses:
        # Safely coerce proxy-like objects (e.g., JsProxy) into a plain dict
        try:
            course_dict = dict(course)
        except Exception:
            # If coercion fails, keep the original object (best-effort fallback)
            course_dict = course

        # Build an n8n-compliant output item (must contain a "json" key)
        output_items.append({"json": course_dict})

# Return the flattened list: one output item per course across all received pages
return output_items

# n8n - Code in Python (Native)
# Execution mode: Run Once for All Items
#
# Inputs:
#   - Multiple incoming items from the previous node (available as `_items`).
#   - Each incoming item is expected to contain:
#       item["json"]["body"]: a list of Canvas students for a single pagination page.
#
# Purpose:
#   - Normalize Canvas pagination by flattening multiple "pages" of students into
#     a single output stream.
#   - Emit one n8n-compliant item per student, wrapped under the required "json" key.
#
# Output:
#   - A list of items in the form:
#       [{"json": <student_dict>}, {"json": <student_dict>}, ...]


# Accumulates the flattened output (one item per student across all pages)
output_items = []

# In n8n Native Python, all incoming items are available via `_items`
for item in _items:
    # Safely extract the JSON payload from the current incoming item
    item_data = item.get("json", {}) or {}

    # Retrieve the list of students for the current page (defaults to an empty list)
    body_students = item_data.get("body") or []

    # Emit one output item per student
    for student in body_students:
        # Safely coerce proxy-like objects (e.g., JsProxy) into a plain dict
        try:
            student_dict = dict(student)
        except Exception:
            # If coercion fails, keep the original object (best-effort fallback)
            student_dict = student

        # Build an n8n-compliant output item (must contain a "json" key)
        output_items.append({"json": student_dict})

# Return the flattened list: one output item per student across all received pages
return output_items

pagination.nextURL: ={{ ( $response.headers.link || '' ) .split(',') .map(p => p.trim()) .find(p => p.includes('rel="next"')) ?.match(/<([^>]+)>/)?.[1] // captura a URL entre <...> || '' }}
pagination.completeExpression: ={{   /*     Checks if there is NO next link in pagination     (no Link header or no rel="next")   */   !$response.headers.link ||   !$response.headers.link.includes('rel="next"') }}

parameters.pythonCode:
# n8n - Code in Python (Native)
# Execution mode: Run Once for All Items
#
# Inputs:
#   - Multiple incoming items from the previous node (available as `_items`).
#   - Each incoming item is expected to contain:
#       item["json"]["body"]: a list of Canvas submissions for a single pagination page.
#
# Purpose:
#   - Normalize Canvas pagination by flattening multiple "pages" of submissions into
#     a single output stream.
#   - Emit one n8n-compliant item per submission, wrapped under the required "json" key.
#
# Output:
#   - A list of items in the form:
#       [{"json": <submit_dict>}, {"json": <submit_dict>}, ...]


# Accumulates the flattened output (one item per submit across all pages)
output_items = []

# In n8n Native Python, all incoming items are available via `_items`
for item in _items:
    # Safely extract the JSON payload from the current incoming item
    item_data = item.get("json", {}) or {}

    # Retrieve the list of submits for the current page (defaults to an empty list)
    body_submits = item_data.get("body") or []

    # Emit one output item per submit
    for submit in body_submits:
        # Safely coerce proxy-like objects (e.g., JsProxy) into a plain dict
        try:
            submit_dict = dict(submit)
        except Exception:
            # If coercion fails, keep the original object (best-effort fallback)
            submit_dict = submit

        # Build an n8n-compliant output item (must contain a "json" key)
        output_items.append({"json": submit_dict})

# Return the flattened list: one output item per submit across all received pages
return output_items

# n8n - Code in Python (Native)
# Execution mode: Run Once for All Items
#
# Inputs (IMPORTANT):
#   - This node expects the output of a Merge node configured as "Append".
#   - The Merge node must append two independent streams into a single list:
#       1) Student records from "Agregate students pagination"
#       2) Submission records from "Agregate submits pagination"
#
# Purpose:
#   - Split the appended incoming items into two groups (students vs. submissions).
#   - Build a lookup map (student_id -> student record).
#   - Enrich each submission with student identity fields plus key assignment metadata.
#   - Convert "assignment.due_at" to S√£o Paulo time (UTC-03:00) and format as DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS.
#
# Output:
#   - One output item per submission:
#       {"json": {student fields + assignment fields + submission fields}}


def _to_key(value):
    """
    Normalize IDs to comparable string keys.

    Canvas IDs may arrive as int, float-like, or string. This helper ensures we
    can reliably match student.id with submission.user_id.
    """
    if value is None:
        return None

    try:
        return str(int(value))
    except Exception:
        text = str(value).strip()
        return text or None


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Date helpers (no imports) - ISO 8601 -> S√£o Paulo (UTC-03:00) formatter
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

def _is_leap_year(year):
    """Return True if year is a leap year in the Gregorian calendar."""
    if (year % 400) == 0:
        return True
    if (year % 100) == 0:
        return False
    return (year % 4) == 0


def _days_in_month(year, month):
    """Return the number of days in a given month."""
    if month in (1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 10, 12):
        return 31
    if month in (4, 6, 9, 11):
        return 30
    # February
    return 29 if _is_leap_year(year) else 28


def _increment_day(year, month, day):
    """Add one day to a YYYY-MM-DD date."""
    dim = _days_in_month(year, month)
    day += 1
    if day > dim:
        day = 1
        month += 1
        if month > 12:
            month = 1
            year += 1
    return year, month, day


def _decrement_day(year, month, day):
    """Subtract one day from a YYYY-MM-DD date."""
    day -= 1
    if day < 1:
        month -= 1
        if month < 1:
            month = 12
            year -= 1
        day = _days_in_month(year, month)
    return year, month, day


def _parse_iso8601(dt_text):
    """
    Parse an ISO 8601 datetime string into components:
      (year, month, day, hour, minute, second, offset_minutes)

    Supported examples:
      - 2025-12-19T02:59:59Z
      - 2025-12-19T02:59:59.123Z
      - 2025-12-19T02:59:59+00:00
      - 2025-12-19T02:59:59-03:00

    Returns None if parsing fails.
    """
    if not dt_text:
        return None

    text = str(dt_text).strip()
    if not text:
        return None

    offset_minutes = None

    # Handle trailing 'Z' (UTC)
    if text.endswith("Z"):
        offset_minutes = 0
        text = text[:-1]

    # Handle explicit timezone offsets ¬±HH:MM (only if not already 'Z')
    if offset_minutes is None and len(text) >= 6:
        tail = text[-6:]
        sign = tail[0]
        if sign in ("+", "-") and tail[3] == ":":
            try:
                off_h = int(tail[1:3])
                off_m = int(tail[4:6])
                offset_minutes = off_h * 60 + off_m
                if sign == "-":
                    offset_minutes = -offset_minutes
                text = text[:-6]
            except Exception:
                return None

    # Default: if no timezone specified, treat as UTC
    if offset_minutes is None:
        offset_minutes = 0

    # Split date and time
    if "T" in text:
        date_part, time_part = text.split("T", 1)
    elif " " in text:
        date_part, time_part = text.split(" ", 1)
    else:
        return None

    # Drop fractional seconds if present
    if "." in time_part:
        time_part = time_part.split(".", 1)[0]

    try:
        y_str, mo_str, d_str = date_part.split("-", 2)
        hh_str, mm_str, ss_str = time_part.split(":", 2)

        year = int(y_str)
        month = int(mo_str)
        day = int(d_str)
        hour = int(hh_str)
        minute = int(mm_str)
        second = int(ss_str)

        return year, month, day, hour, minute, second, offset_minutes
    except Exception:
        return None


def _shift_by_minutes(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, delta_minutes):
    """Shift a datetime by delta_minutes, normalizing date rollover (no imports)."""
    total_seconds = (hour * 3600) + (minute * 60) + second
    total_seconds += int(delta_minutes) * 60

    # Normalize seconds across day boundaries
    while total_seconds < 0:
        total_seconds += 86400
        year, month, day = _decrement_day(year, month, day)

    while total_seconds >= 86400:
        total_seconds -= 86400
        year, month, day = _increment_day(year, month, day)

    hour = total_seconds // 3600
    rem = total_seconds % 3600
    minute = rem // 60
    second = rem % 60

    return year, month, day, hour, minute, second


def format_due_sao_paulo(due_at):
    """
    Convert a Canvas ISO 8601 datetime string to S√£o Paulo local time (UTC-03:00),
    returning a string formatted as 'DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS'.

    Notes:
      - This uses a fixed UTC-03:00 offset (GMT-3).
      - If parsing fails, returns the original input.
    """
    if not due_at:
        return ""

    parsed = _parse_iso8601(due_at)
    if not parsed:
        return due_at

    year, month, day, hour, minute, second, offset_minutes = parsed

    # Convert "local time at offset" -> UTC -> S√£o Paulo (UTC-03:00)
    # UTC = local - offset_minutes
    # SP  = UTC  - 180 minutes
    delta_minutes = (-offset_minutes) - 180

    year, month, day, hour, minute, second = _shift_by_minutes(
        year, month, day, hour, minute, second, delta_minutes
    )

    dd = str(day).zfill(2)
    mm = str(month).zfill(2)
    yyyy = str(year).zfill(4)
    hh = str(hour).zfill(2)
    mi = str(minute).zfill(2)
    ss = str(second).zfill(2)

    return f"{dd}/{mm}/{yyyy} {hh}:{mi}:{ss}"


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# 1) Split appended incoming items into: students and submissions
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

students_map = {}
submissions = []

for item in _items:
    payload = item.get("json", {}) or {}

    # Heuristic classification:
    # - Submissions typically contain "user_id" and an "assignment" object.
    # - Students typically contain "id" plus identity fields like "login_id",
    #   "sis_user_id", etc.
    is_submission = ("user_id" in payload) and ("assignment" in payload)

    if is_submission:
        submissions.append(payload)
        continue

    # Treat as a student record when it has an identifiable "id"
    student_id_raw = payload.get("id")
    student_key = _to_key(student_id_raw)

    if student_key is not None:
        students_map[student_key] = payload


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# 2) Enrich submissions using the student lookup map + format due_at (SP time)
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

output_items = []

for submission in submissions:
    assignment = submission.get("assignment") or {}

    student_id_raw = submission.get("user_id")
    student_key = _to_key(student_id_raw)

    student_data = students_map.get(student_key, {}) or {}

    due_at_raw = assignment.get("due_at")
    due_at_sp = format_due_sao_paulo(due_at_raw)

    output_items.append({
        "json": {
            # Student identity
            "student_id": student_id_raw,
            "student_name": student_data.get("name"),
            "sis_user_id": student_data.get("sis_user_id"),
            "login_id": student_data.get("login_id"),
            "email": student_data.get("email"),

            # Assignment identity
            "assignment_id": assignment.get("id"),
            "assignment_name": assignment.get("name"),

            # Due date/time (converted to S√£o Paulo time and formatted)
            "due_at": due_at_sp,

            # Submission / assignment metadata
            "workflow_state": submission.get("workflow_state"),
            "html_url": assignment.get("html_url"),
        }
    })

return output_items

# n8n - Code in Python (Native)
# Execution mode: Run Once for All Items
#
# Inputs:
#   - Multiple incoming items from the previous node (available as `_items`).
#   - Each item["json"] is expected to contain (one pending assignment per item):
#       student_id, student_name, sis_user_id, login_id, email,
#       assignment_id, assignment_name, due_at, workflow_state, html_url
#
# Purpose:
#   - Group pending assignments by student_id.
#   - Build a consolidated, human-readable text summary per student.
#   - Emit one output item per student, in n8n-compliant format.
#
#
# Output:
#   - A list of items in the form:
#       [{"json": {student fields + pending_count + pending_summary}}, ...]


# Accumulates all output items to be returned by this node
output_items = []

# In n8n Native Python, all incoming items are available via `_items`
input_items = _items


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# 1) Group pending assignments by student_id
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

grouped_by_student = {}

for item in input_items:
    # Safely extract the JSON payload from the current incoming item
    item_data = item.get("json", {}) or {}

    # Student identity fields (used both for grouping and message personalization)
    student_id = item_data.get("student_id")
    student_name = item_data.get("student_name")
    sis_user_id = item_data.get("sis_user_id")
    login_id = item_data.get("login_id")
    email = item_data.get("email")

    # Assignment fields (one "pending assignment" record per incoming item)
    assignment_id = item_data.get("assignment_id")
    assignment_name = item_data.get("assignment_name")
    due_at = item_data.get("due_at")
    workflow_state = item_data.get("workflow_state")
    html_url = item_data.get("html_url")

    # Initialize the student group on first occurrence
    if student_id not in grouped_by_student:
        grouped_by_student[student_id] = {
            "student_id": student_id,
            "student_name": student_name,
            "sis_user_id": sis_user_id,
            "login_id": login_id,
            "email": email,
            "pending_assignments": [],
        }

    # Append the current pending assignment to the student's list
    grouped_by_student[student_id]["pending_assignments"].append(
        {
            "assignment_id": assignment_id,
            "assignment_name": assignment_name,
            "due_at": due_at,
            "workflow_state": workflow_state,
            "html_url": html_url,
        }
    )


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# 2) Build consolidated text summary per student and emit output items
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

for student in grouped_by_student.values():
    lines = []

    student_id = student.get("student_id")
    student_name = (student.get("student_name") or "").strip()
    sis_user_id = student.get("sis_user_id")
    login_id = student.get("login_id")
    email = student.get("email")
    pending_assignments = student.get("pending_assignments", [])

    # Header line with student identification (personalized greeting)
    if student_name:
        greeting = f"Ol√°, {student_name}, tudo bem?\n\n"
    else:
        # Best-effort fallback when the student's name is missing upstream
        greeting = "Ol√°, tudo bem?\n\n"

    lines.append(
        greeting
        + "Consta no Canvas da PUC Minas que voc√™ ainda n√£o realizou ou entregou "
        + "as seguintes atividades:\n\n"
    )

    # Handle case with no pending assignments for the student
    if not pending_assignments:
        lines.append("- Nenhuma pend√™ncia encontrada.")
    else:
        # Detail each pending assignment in a numbered list
        for index, assignment in enumerate(pending_assignments, start=1):
            assignment_name = assignment.get("assignment_name") or "Sem t√≠tulo"
            due = assignment.get("due_at") or "sem data final"
            html_url = assignment.get("html_url") or "sem link"

            lines.append(
                f"{index}) {assignment_name}\n"
                f"- Data limite para entrega: {due}\n"
                f"- Link: {html_url}\n\n"
            )

    # Join all lines into a single multi-line string
    pending_summary_text = "\n".join(lines)

    # Build an n8n-compliant output item (must contain a "json" key)
    output_items.append(
        {
            "json": {
                "student_id": student_id,
                "student_name": student_name or None,
                "sis_user_id": sis_user_id,
                "login_id": login_id,
                "email": email,
                "pending_count": len(pending_assignments),
                "pending_summary": pending_summary_text,
            }
        }
    )

# Return one item per student with the aggregated summary
return output_items

parameters.content: ## Organize and format pending submissions information
## Send pending submissions alert to students

## Canvas: Send students their pending assignments

### How it works
1. Trigger the workflow and set the Canvas base URL and target course name.
2. Fetch all instructor courses and locate the course ID that matches the name.
3. Retrieve enrolled students and their unsubmitted submissions for the course, handling paginated results.
4. Merge student records with submission data, convert due dates to local time, and build a per-student summary.
5. Send a Canvas conversation to each student with a personalized list of pending assignments and links.

### Setup
- [ ] Connect Canvas API credentials (Bearer and header auth used by the workflow).
- [ ] Enter your Canvas base URL (e.g. https://your_educational_institution.instructure.com).
- [ ] Set the exact course name to check for pending work.
- [ ] Confirm the teacher account can view students and send conversations.
- [ ] Run the workflow manually to verify output and delivery.
- [ ] Edit the message subject or body template if you need different wording.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
